translation:
Having received the Most Illustrious Sir's communication of the 26th of June last, with the purpose of informing me of the rebellion in Porto Alegre, the release of the individuals imprisoned there, and the arrest of Marciano, Silvano, and about fifty more of their companions, and that forces from São Leopoldo had marched to the capital to aid the legitimate party of order, in return for such important notice, and, above all, bound by the polite expressions of His Excellency on the 10th of the current month; it is added that on the 11th another force of the Division of the Superior Commander Silva Tavares, stationed at the Ponta do Chasqueiro under the command of Cirilo, was attacked and destroyed by another force under Lieutenant João Simplício, with Cirilo and only two men escaping from there, the prisoners already being at the Farroupilha fort.

I take this opportunity to offer my respects and consideration to the Most Illustrious Sir.  
Pelotas, 14th of September, 1836.  
Domingos José de Almeida  
Colonel, Chief of the Legion of the District of Rio Grande.
